data.title: ISRAEL: ISRAELI WRITER SHMUEL YOSEF AGNON NOMINATED FOR THIS YEAR'S NOBEL PRIZE FOR LITERATURE
data.meta_description: Search and license clips from Reuters vast archive of news video footage, dating back to 1896
data.text:
Title: ISRAEL: ISRAELI WRITER SHMUEL YOSEF AGNON NOMINATED FOR THIS YEAR'S NOBEL PRIZE FOR LITERATURE

Summary: MR. AGNON WITH MEMBERS OF HIS FAMILY; TALKING TO NEWSMEN; MR. AGNON TOASTED; NEWSMEN. Initials JMC/V--S/AE/RM/JG Script is copyright Reuters Limited. All rights reserved

Embargoed: 3rd November 1966 12:00

Keywords:

Location: JERUSALEM, ISRAEL

Country: Israel

Reuters ID: LVA1ZZ7FODG4A19WLAMOLGCCJLE7

Story Text: RADIO STOCKHOLM ANNOUNCED TODAY (WEDNESDAY) THAT THE ISRAELI WRITER, MR. SHMUEL YOSEF AGNON, HAD BEEN NOMINATED FOR THIS YEAR'S NOBEL PRIZE FOR LITERATURE. IN JERUSALEM, THE ISRAELI BROADCASTING SERVICE QUOTED A REPORT FROM STOCKHOLM THAT THE OFFICIAL ANNOUNCEMENT OF THE AWARD WOULD BE MADE TOMORROW (THURSDAY).

MR. AGNON, WHO IS 78, WAS BORN IN POLAND AND WENT TO LIVE IN PALESTINE, AS IT THEN WAS, IN 1907. HIS MAIN PUBLICATIONS ARE EIGHT VOLUMES OF SHORT STORIES AND NOVELS. HE WRITES IN CLASSICAL HEBREW STRONGLY INFLUENCED BY THE LANGUAGE OF THE BIBLE. MANY OF HIS WORKS DEAL WITH PEOPLE AND SITUATIONS IN HIS OLD POLISH-UKRAINIAN HOMELAND.

THE BEST-KNOWN OF HIS WORKS ARE "BRIDAL CANOPY", BOTH THESE AND OTHER THINGS," "A WAYFARER STAYING THE NIGHT" AND "YOU HAVE SEEN." THE LAST IS A COLLECTION OF WRITINGS ON THE DIVINE REVALUATIONS ON MOUNT SINAI AND EXPRESS MR. AGNON'S DEEP RELIGIOUS BELIEFS.

THE ISRAELI PRIME MINISTER, MR. ESHKOL, HAS SENT A MESSAGE OF CONGRATULATION TO MR. AGNON, EXPRESSING HIS ADMIRATION FOR THE AUTHOR'S CONTRIBUTION TO MODERN HEBREW LITERATURE.

MR. AGNON LIVES IN THE JERUSALEM SUBURB OF TALPIOT. OUR FILM SHOWS HIM WITH MEMBERS OF HIS FAMILY AND BEING INTERVIEWED BY NEWSMEN AFTER IT WAS LEARNED THAT HE HAD BEEN NOMINATED FOR THE NOBEL PRIZE.

Copyright Holder: REUTERS
